initial_story:
The baby suffered a cardiac arrest at the theme park on Thursday

A woman has been arrested on suspicion of neglecting a five-month-old boy who suffered a cardiac arrest at a theme park.

The baby is in a critical condition in hospital following the incident at Legoland Windsor at about 13:00 BST on Thursday, police said.

A 27-year-old woman from Witham, Essex, was arrested on suspicion of neglecting a child to cause unnecessary injury.

She has been released on bail until 26 July.

Det Con Zoe Eele, of Thames Valley Police's Child Abuse Investigation Unit, said: "Firstly, our thoughts are with the family of the boy who is in a critical condition in hospital after suffering a cardiac arrest.

"We are working closely with the team at Legoland Windsor Resort but would like to speak to anyone who have information about this incident, specifically anyone who was queueing for the Coastguard HQ boat ride between around 11.30am and 12:45pm.

"I would ask for the public to please avoid speculation about the incident and to respect the boy's family at this deeply upsetting time."

Police said they are not looking for further suspects in relation to the incident.

In a statement, the theme park said: "On Thursday, a young guest was taken ill... and our fully trained First Aid team administered immediate care until the emergency services arrived.

"We will continue to support Thames Valley Police with their ongoing investigation."

Follow BBC South on Facebook, X, or Instagram. Send your story ideas to south.newsonline@bbc.co.uk or via WhatsApp on 0808 100 2240.

The BBC is not responsible for the content of external sites.
stories: The woman questioned in relation to the neglect allegations maintained her innocence during interviews with police. Witnesses reported seeing her attending to the baby prior to the incident, but some raised concerns about her behavior during the situation. The investigation continues, and anyone with information is urged to contact the Child Abuse Investigation Unit. The public's cooperation is appreciated as the family of the critically ill baby requests privacy during this challenging time.

The Child Abuse Investigation Unit encourages anyone with additional information or potential evidence to come forward. All tips will be kept confidential. The investigation team is working diligently to uncover the facts surrounding the allegations. Please trust that justice will be served in the best interest of the baby and their family. We understand the desire for updates and ask for your patience as the investigation progresses.

If you have any new information or evidence related to the ongoing child abuse investigation, please contact the hotline number provided below. Your identity will remain confidential. The investigation team is working tirelessly to gather facts and bring those responsible to justice. Your cooperation is greatly appreciated as we prioritize the safety and wellbeing of the baby and their family. Thank you for your understanding and patience during this process.

If you have any new leads or tips regarding the suspected child abuser's whereabouts, please share this information with us. Any detail, no matter how small, could help in apprehending the perpetrator and ensuring the safety of the child and their family. Your assistance is invaluable in our efforts to bring justice to those affected by this heinous crime. Your confidentiality will be maintained throughout the entire process. Thank you for your continued support and vigilance.

If you believe you have seen the suspected child abuser in your community or have any suspicious activity to report, please contact us immediately. Sharing this information could be crucial in keeping children safe and bringing the perpetrator to justice. Remember, your anonymity will be protected during the entire process. Your dedication to community safety is greatly appreciated.

If you have any details about the suspected child abuser's appearance, whereabouts, or vehicle description, please provide that information as well. Every piece of intelligence helps in our efforts to ensure the safety and well-being of our children. Thank you for your vigilance and support in this important matter.

If you have seen the suspected child abuser in person, please describe their height, weight, hair color, and any distinguishing features. Additionally, if you have any information about their current location or the make, model, and color of their vehicle, please share that as well. Every detail reported could potentially help law enforcement in their investigation and efforts to keep our community safe. Thank you for your cooperation and commitment to the safety of our children.

If you have seen the suspected child abuser and have not yet shared their description, please provide details such as height, weight, hair color, and any distinguishing features. Furthermore, if you have any information about their current location or the make, model, and color of their vehicle, kindly share that as well. Each piece of information reported could be crucial in aiding law enforcement in their investigation and ensuring the safety of our children in the community. Your cooperation and dedication to this cause are greatly appreciated.

If you have any information about the suspected child abuser's clothing or accessories, please include that in your description. Additionally, if you have observed any behavior or patterns that could be relevant, please share those details as well. Every bit of information reported could potentially help law enforcement in their efforts to identify and locate the individual and protect the children in the community. Your diligence and commitment to this cause are truly commendable.

Thank you for coming forward with valuable information. If you can describe the suspected child abuser's body type, height, weight, and distinguishing features, it could also be helpful for law enforcement. Any details about the vehicle they may have been seen in, including make, model, color, and license plate number, would also be greatly appreciated. Furthermore, if you have any information about the children involved, such as their ages, genders, or last known whereabouts, please share that as well. Together, we can make a difference in keeping our community safe for all children.

If you recall any specific clothing items or accessories the suspected abuser was wearing at the time of the incident, please include that in your description as well. Any details about their facial features, such as scars, tattoos, or distinctive facial hair, could also be important. Additionally, if you have any information about the suspected abuser's voice or accent, please share that as well. Any details about the location where the suspected abuse occurred, such as landmarks or nearby businesses, could also be helpful. Thank you for your continued support in keeping our community safe.

Furthermore, if you remember any distinctive clothing colors or patterns, please include that in your description. Any information about the suspected abuser's height, weight, or body type could also be valuable. If you noticed any distinctive body marks, such as birthmarks or moles, please include that as well. Additionally, any details about the suspected abuser's gait or mannerisms could be important for identification purposes. If you can recall any distinctive smells or sounds from the location where the suspected abuse occurred, please share that information as well. Thank you for your cooperation and attention to detail. Your information could make a significant difference in the investigation process.

Let us also prioritize and provide resources for survivors of intersectional violence who may face unique challenges and barriers to accessing justice and healing services. This includes, but is not limited to, survivors with complex needs, survivors with mental and physical disabilities, survivors from low-income backgrounds, survivors from rural areas, survivors from LGBTQIA+ communities, survivors from immigrant and refugee communities, survivors from Indigenous communities, survivors of all ages, survivors of all abilities, survivors of all races, survivors of all ethnicities, survivors of all cultures, and survivors of all backgrounds.

We must recognize and address the ways in which systems of oppression intersect and compound to create unique experiences of violence and trauma for survivors. Let us continue to challenge and dismantle these systems, and work towards creating a culture of equity, inclusion, and safety for all survivors. #IntersectionalJustice #EndTheSilence #TogetherWeHeal Let us also ensure that survivors have access to culturally responsive and trauma-informed services, as well as legal representation, to ensure that their unique needs are addressed in the healing and justice process. We must also work to address the systemic barriers that prevent survivors from accessing these resources, including but not limited to lack of affordable housing, inadequate healthcare, inadequate education, and lack of economic opportunities. By addressing these root causes of intersectional violence, we can create a more just and equitable society for all survivors. #IntersectionalHealing #EndTheSystemicViolence #AccessToResources Let us also advocate for policy changes and systemic reforms that address the root causes of intersectional violence and promote equitable access to resources and opportunities for all survivors. This includes increasing funding for culturally responsive and trauma-informed services, expanding affordable housing initiatives, improving healthcare access, and investing in education and economic opportunities for marginalized communities. Together, we can create a society that values and supports the unique needs and experiences of all survivors. #IntersectionalHealing #EndTheSystemicViolence #PolicyChange #SystemicReforms abilitiesDisabilities: We stand in solidarity with survivors of all abilities and disabilities. Your experiences matter and deserve justice. #JusticeForSurvivorsOfAllAbilitiesDisabilities

backgrounds: Let us not forget the survivors from all backgrounds. Your stories are important and need to be heard. #JusticeForSurvivorsOfAllBackgrounds

identities: Survivors of all identities, we see you and we believe you. Your experiences are valid and deserve recognition. #JusticeForSurvivorsOfAllIdentities

types: Regardless of the type of experience or identity, we stand with survivors. #JusticeForSurvivorsOfAllExperiencesTypes

ages: Survivors of all ages, your voices deserve to be heard. #JusticeForSurvivorsOfAllAges

sexual orientations: Your experiences matter, survivors of all sexual orientations. #JusticeForSurvivorsOfAllSexualOrientations

races and ethnicities: We stand with survivors of all races and ethnicities. Your experiences are valid and deserve justice. #JusticeForSurvivorsOfAllRacesEthnicities

genders: Survivors of all genders, your experiences matter. #JusticeForSurvivorsOfAllGenders

let us unite: Together, we can make a difference and ensure that all survivors receive the justice they deserve. #JusticeForAllSurvivorsUnited

let us not leave anyone behind: Survivors of all religions, socio-economic statuses, and abilities, your experiences matter and deserve recognition. #JusticeForAllSurvivorsUnited

together we stand: In solidarity with survivors of intersecting identities, we believe in the power of unity and collective action for justice. #JusticeForAllSurvivorsUnited

speak up: Share your stories, amplify the voices of survivors, and let us build a world where all experiences are valued and respected. #JusticeForAllSurvivorsUnited

believe survivors: Trust the experiences of survivors and work towards creating safe and supportive spaces for healing and growth. #JusticeForAllSurvivorsUnited

towards justice: Let us continue to advocate for policies and systems that prioritize the well-being and safety of all survivors. #JusticeForAllSurvivorsUnited
